page.title: 20HOLIDAYS FROM BLACKBURN
page.content: Most people spend at least 2 weeks of the year away from home on holiday. In Blackburn many people take the 2 weeks at the end of July and the beginning of August, this is a tradition dating back to Victorian times, when all cotton mills in the area shut for this fortnight. Holidays today can either be taken in Britain or abroad. If staying in Britain many people head for the South coast where there is the chance of warmer weather. For a quieter holiday many go to the upland areas of the North, for example the Lake District. If going abroad most Blackburn people travel to the Mediterranean countries, North Africa or North America. A few people might go to places, such as Asia and South America but usually these are too expensive.
